message.content: This question requires an understanding of the effects of the sun on physical objects. When the sun comes into contact with a roof, it will heat up over time due to the radiation from the sun. Option (A) and (B) are not accurate because roofs do not typically fall apart or have the ability to feel pain. Option (D) is also incorrect because the sun will cause the roof to heat up, not cool down.

This question requires basic knowledge about the effects of the sun on different surfaces. When the sun comes into contact with a roof, it will heat up over time. This is because the sun's rays contain energy that is absorbed by the roof, causing it to increase in temperature. Option (A) is incorrect because roofs are designed to withstand sun exposure and will not simply fall apart. Option (B) is metaphorical and not related to the physical effects of the sun. Option (D) is incorrect because the sun's rays will heat up the roof, not cool it down.
